data.title: Vehicle counter
data.solution:
import numpy as np
n = int(input())
grid = np.array([list(input()) for i in range(n)],dtype=int)
nx=[0,0,0]
while np.sum(grid)>0:
    rx,cx = np.where(grid==1)
    ri=rx[0]
    ci=cx[0]
    if np.sum(grid[ri+1:ri+4,ci])==0:
        nx[2]+=1
        grid[ri:ri+5,ci:ci+4] = 0
    elif grid[ri+1,ci]==0:
        nx[1]+=1
        grid[ri:ri+3,ci:ci+2] = 0
    else:
        nx[0]+=1
        grid[ri:ri+2,ci] = 0
for key,val in zip(['bicycles','cars','buses'],nx):
    print(f'{key}: {val}')
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read measurement:string(5)
write vehiclenumbers
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> integer [[n]], number of line measurements.
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> string [[measurement]] of length {{5}}, consisting of {{1}} (signal) and {{0}} (no signal).
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> {{bicycles: }} [[nbicycles]] (number of bicycles that were counted)
<<Line 2:>> {{cars:}} [[ncars]] (number of cars that were counted)
<<Line 3:>> {{buses:}} [[nbuses]] (number of buses that were counted)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

On a road of width 5 a vehicle counter is installed, which gives a signal if a tire crosses the measurement line. Given a certain number of measurements n, you must output the number of bicycles, cars and buses counted.
Three vehicle types (bicycle, car, bus) have each a distinct signal based on their number of tires and size (rows * columns).
- Bicycle: two tires, size 2x1;
- Car: four tires, size 3x2;
- Bus: four tires, size 5x4.
With 1 for signal and 0 for no signal, the three vehicles (if driving fully left and directly behind each other) will be measured as follows:
10000
10000
11000
00000
11000
10010
00000
00000
00000
10010
The first two lines show the two tires of a bicycle. Lines 3-5 show the four tires of a car. Lines 6-10 Show the four tires of a bus. So, for this series of ten measurements, the output is:
bicycles: 1
cars: 1
buses: 1

Hints: Every case only consists out of whole vehicles (there are no spare tires or partial vehicles). Vehicle patterns are chosen such that, when iteratively taking the top/left tire, it will only match one of the three vehicle patterns.
Input
Line 1: integer n, number of line measurements.
Next n lines: string measurement of length 5, consisting of 1 (signal) and 0 (no signal).
Output
Line 1: bicycles: nbicycles (number of bicycles that were counted)
Line 2: cars: ncars (number of cars that were counted)
Line 3: buses: nbuses (number of buses that were counted)
Constraints
1<n<20
0<=nbicycles, ncars, nbuses<=15
Example
Input
5
00000
01000
01000
00000
00000
Output
bicycles: 1
cars: 0
buses: 0
